    • Method Detail

      • populate

        public void populate(java.sql.ResultSet result)
        Populate Row attributes with data from ResultSet. All column of ResultSet must correspond to a proprerty of Row Object. With this, you can use result as an object (without use try catch and abstrating more from relational logic)
        Parameters:
        result - ResultSet from fetch()

      • save

        public boolean save()
        Save current row into db. If row exist, it will update row. If row doesn't exist, it will insert new row.
        Returns:
        boolean.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Delete row from database.

      • valueToString

        protected java.lang.String valueToString()
        Create a String from Object attributes value.
        Returns:
        String

      • valueToMap

        protected java.util.HashMap valueToMap()
        Create a map from Object. Map key is Object attribute, Map value is attribute value
        Returns:
        HashMap
